title-group.article-title: Capping Environmental Liability: The Case of North American Nuclear Power

permissions.copyright-statement: © Copyright 2000 The International Association for the Study of Insurance Economics

abstract.p: The liability of operators of nuclear power stations for off-site damage done by accidents is capped by the Price-Anderson Act in the U.S. and the Nuclear Liability Act in Canada. Such capping constitutes a subsidy to nuclear vis-à-vis other sources of energy. We report the results of analyses aimed to estimate the size of that implicit subsidy.
